alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 11:13PM EDT until April 20 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Michigamme River near Witch Lake affecting Dickinson and Marquette Counties. Sturgeon River near Chassell affecting Baraga and Houghton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn. * WHEN...Until late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Low lying areas of Peter Nordeen Park begin to flood * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:56 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:56 PM EDT Wednesday was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall slowly. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.5 feet on 04/26/1979. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Thursday afternoon at 100 PM CDT /200 PM EDT/.
